How can I check if my Verus server is set to mine and/or mint coins, and what information will I get as a result?

To check if your Verus server is set to mine and/or mint coins, you can use the `getgenerate` command. This command returns information about the current mining and minting settings on your server.

The result of the `getgenerate` command is a JSON object that contains three properties:

* `"staking"`: a boolean value indicating whether staking (minting) is enabled or disabled.
* `"generate"`: a boolean value indicating whether mining is enabled or disabled.
* `"numthreads"`: a numeric value indicating the processor limit for mining.

You can use the `getgenerate` command in two ways:

1. By running the command directly in the Verus console: `verus getgenerate`
2. By sending a JSON-RPC request to the Verus server using a tool like `curl`: `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getgenerate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`

Note that the `getgenerate` command only returns information about the current mining and minting settings, and does not allow you to change these settings. To change the settings, you need to use the `setgenerate` command or modify the Verus configuration file.

getgenerate

Return if the server is set to mine and/or mint coins or not. The default is false.
It is set with the command line argument -gen and -mint (or conf file settings gen and mint)
It can also be set with the setgenerate call.

Result
{
 "staking": true|false   (boolean) If staking is on or off (see setgenerate)
 "generate": true|false   (boolean) If mining is on or off (see setgenerate)
 "numthreads": n      (numeric) The processor limit for mining. (see setgenerate)
}

Examples:
> verus getgenerate 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getgenerate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
